company and organization, demonstrate the product, present the product to the customer, trade evaluation
on trade in vehicles, handle and by pass customer objections politely, write up the customer in a professional
manner on a credit application, negotiate and present figures to a customer, deliver their new vehicle to the
customer, follow up for future business or any questions or concerns.          Produce Clerk   01/2013   to   12/2014     Company Name   City  ,   State       Keep work area clean at all times, make sure produce is presentable and fresh, re stock and and always keep
produce full, unloading new shipments of fresh produce off of pallets, keeping a safe and clean back room
environment, and always give great customer service to customers. Bakersfield College            Skills    Great
Communication Skills, credit, customer service, Customer
Service, English, Inventory, Negotiation, Pallet Jack, pick, Presentation Skills, rapport, Sales, Spanish, Phones        Additional Information      Willing to relocate: Anywhere
Authorized to work in the US for any employer
personality:
From reading between the lines, here's what I can interpret about this candidate's personality:

1. Adaptable and Resilient
- Has worked in very different environments (from field work to sales)
- Willing to relocate anywhere, showing flexibility
- Has performed both physical labor and customer-facing roles

2. People-Oriented
- Strong emphasis on customer interaction in their sales role
- Uses phrases like "build rapport" and "meet and greet"
- Focuses on interpersonal aspects of their work

3. Detail-Oriented
- Notes specific aspects of keeping produce "presentable and fresh"
- Mentions cleanliness multiple times
- Thorough in describing sales process steps

4. Hard-Working
- Background in field work shows comfort with manual labor
- Multiple mentions of maintaining and restocking in produce role
- Comprehensive approach to sales process

5. Growth-Minded
- Progression from field worker to produce clerk to sales associate shows upward career trajectory
- Bilingual skills suggest self-improvement
- Education shows continued learning

6. Service-Oriented
- Consistently mentions customer service across roles
- Emphasizes professional and polite interactions
- Focus on follow-up and customer satisfaction

This appears to be someone who is ambitious, hardworking, and has strong interpersonal skills, with a background that suggests they're not afraid to start from the bottom and work their way up.
